intro: Pimpinella leucocarpa, commonly known as white fruit parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves and small white or yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels. Its fruits are distinctive, being white and spherical, which gives it its common name. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and aromatic qualities.
